column4: hello, when i want to access an AppleShare IP server (not provide one), do i still have to install netatalk?
i don't believe so. it looks like ubuntu kernels ship with the appletalk kernel module, so it should Just Work
can you point me to some sort of tutorial on how to access such a server?
i can certainly look :) just a moment
thanks alot. all the info i found was on setting up a server.
are you wanting to connect to disks or printers? or both?
setup is an old (ancient, rather) powerPC with a shared folder (so it's disk)... other macs can find the shared folder in the network browser... i want to access it with my ubuntu pc
does that version of appleshare support samba? i see that some of them do
i don't think so. it's MacOS 9...
i thought mod-ssl came with ubuntu's apache2 by default
a2enmod ssl?
still looking, but you're right, most everything is mac->linux, not the other way around
have you tried anything like    mount -t afp afp://username:password@hostname/ShareName /mnt/ShareName    ?
no, gonna try that right away
(make sure to mkdir /mnt/ShareName if you do try that)
it says: unbekannter Dateisystemtyp „afp“  (unknown FS type "afp")
bummer. i guess it's got the appletalk protocol built into the kernel, but not the apple filesharing protocol
oh, this might work for you: http://sites.google.com/site/alexthepuffin/home
it's a fuse client for AFP access. there're apparently ubuntu .debs in the download area, and the page i just linked gives a quick overview of using the mount_afp utility
too bad there is no more "official" thing in the standard repositories. i'll try the client you linked to. thanks alot for your help.
getting afpfs-ng integrated into ubuntu has been on the wishlist for a while, apparently
but you're welcome, and good luck
